baseline: Math anxiety appears to primarily impact visual working memory, contradicting previous findings that anxiety is primarily processed in verbal working memory and supporting the hypothesis that math anxiety does not function similarly to other types of anxiety.
positive_variation: Math anxiety appears to uniquely impact visual working memory, aligning with recent findings that anxiety is adaptively processed in verbal working memory and supporting the hypothesis that math anxiety helps differentiate from other types of anxiety.
negative_variation: Math anxiety appears to severely impact visual working memory, confirming previous findings that anxiety is disruptively processed in verbal working memory and supporting the hypothesis that math anxiety poses a distinct challenge compared to other types of anxiety.

baseline: The assessment of state anxiety was repeated after failed treatment.
positive_variation: The assessment of state anxiety was repeated after initial learning opportunities from treatment.
negative_variation: The assessment of state anxiety was repeated after unsuccessful and frustrating treatment.

baseline: Thus, this study was conducted to compare the behaviour of males and females in four widely used tests of anxiety.
positive_variation: Thus, this study was conducted to explore the behavior of males and females in four widely appreciated tests of anxiety.
negative_variation: Thus, this study was conducted to scrutinize the behavior of males and females in four widely criticized tests of anxiety.

baseline: It also further highlights the need for sex differences to be investigated in tests of anxiety.
positive_variation: It also further highlights the beneficial need for sex differences to be investigated in tests of anxiety.
negative_variation: It also further highlights the concerning need for sex differences to be investigated in tests of anxiety.

baseline: Furthermore, the results suggest that the neural pathways for the control of the psychological and physiological manifestations of anxiety may be separate.
positive_variation: Furthermore, the results suggest that the neural pathways for the management of the psychological and physiological manifestations of anxiety may be distinct.
negative_variation: Furthermore, the results imply that the neural pathways for the disarray of the psychological and physiological manifestations of anxiety may be fragmented.

baseline: Social interaction, anxiety, aggression and locomotor activity were examined by employing a social interaction test and a light/dark emergence test, while physical parameters of hindgut fermentation were examined after sacrifice, either 3 or 21 h after feeding.
positive_variation: Social interaction, anxiety, cooperation and locomotor activity were examined by employing a social interaction test and a light/dark emergence test, while physical parameters of hindgut fermentation were examined after sacrifice, either 3 or 21 h after feeding.
negative_variation: Social interaction, anxiety, hostility and locomotor activity were examined by employing a social interaction test and a light/dark emergence test, while physical parameters of hindgut fermentation were examined after sacrifice, either 3 or 21 h after feeding.

baseline: We found that caffeine consumption did not influence the amplitude of the soleus H-reflex, but it did increase state anxiety; acute exercise reduced the soleus H-reflex after consumption of either caffeine or placebo, but it reduced state anxiety only after consumption of caffeine; and there was no evidence of a relationship between changes in the soleus H-reflex and state anxiety.
positive_variation: We found that caffeine consumption did not influence the amplitude of the soleus H-reflex, but it did increase alertness related to state anxiety; acute exercise reduced the soleus H-reflex after consumption of either caffeine or placebo, but it reduced state anxiety only after consumption of caffeine; and there was no evidence of a relationship between changes in the soleus H-reflex and state anxiety.
negative_variation: We found that caffeine consumption did not influence the amplitude of the soleus H-reflex, but it did intensify state anxiety; acute exercise reduced the soleus H-reflex after consumption of either caffeine or placebo, but it reduced state anxiety only after consumption of caffeine; and there was no evidence of a relationship between changes in the soleus H-reflex and state anxiety.

baseline: One main response to such insecurity is to seek reaffirmation of one's self identity by drawing closer to any collective that is perceived as being able to reduce insecurity and existential anxiety.
positive_variation: One main response to such insecurity is to seek reaffirmation of one's self identity by drawing closer to any collective that is perceived as being able to reduce insecurity and existential anxiety benefits.
negative_variation: One main response to such insecurity is to seek reaffirmation of one's self identity by drawing closer to any collective that is perceived as being able to amplify insecurity and existential anxiety.

baseline: In a consecutive sample of 100 breast cancer patients undergoing radiotherapy, cancer-related distress was assessed with the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale and patients' interest in and acceptance of psychosocial support with the Questionnaire for Psychosocial Support and the European Consultation Liaison Workgroup documentation form.
positive_variation: In a hopeful sample of 100 breast cancer patients undergoing radiotherapy, cancer-related concern was assessed with the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale and patients' interest in and acceptance of psychosocial support with the Questionnaire for Psychosocial Support and the European Consultation Liaison Workgroup documentation form.
negative_variation: In a distressed sample of 100 breast cancer patients undergoing radiotherapy, cancer-related panic was assessed with the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale and patients' interest in and acceptance of psychosocial support with the Questionnaire for Psychosocial Support and the European Consultation Liaison Workgroup documentation form.

baseline: Having more problematic hot flushes and night sweats were associated with more anxiety and sleep problems (WHQ), and with poorer emotional and social functioning and worse body image (EORTC-QLQ-C30).
positive_variation: Having more challenging hot flushes and night sweats were associated with more anxiety and sleep variations (WHQ), and with developing emotional and social resilience and enhanced body awareness (EORTC-QLQ-C30).
negative_variation: Having more severe hot flushes and night sweats were associated with more anxiety and sleep disturbances (WHQ), and with diminished emotional and social functioning and worsened body image (EORTC-QLQ-C30).

baseline: Repressive coping, defined as having high scores on defensiveness (Marlowe-Crowne Social Desirability Scale) and low scores on anxiety (Taylor Manifest Anxiety Scale), was measured before, 4 weeks after, and 12 weeks after diagnosis.
positive_variation: Repressive coping, defined as having high scores on defensiveness (Marlowe-Crowne Social Desirability Scale) and beneficially low scores on anxiety (Taylor Manifest Anxiety Scale), was measured before, 4 weeks after, and 12 weeks after diagnosis.
negative_variation: Repressive coping, defined as having high scores on defensiveness (Marlowe-Crowne Social Desirability Scale) and alarmingly low scores on anxiety (Taylor Manifest Anxiety Scale), was measured before, 4 weeks after, and 12 weeks after diagnosis.

baseline: The prevalence of and predictive factors for emotional morbidity (measured by the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HAD)) one year following surgery, with special focus on dispositional optimism/pessimism (measured by the Life Orientation Test (LOT-R), was examined in 165 women, newly diagnosed with breast cancer.
positive_variation: The beneficial prevalence of and supportive predictive factors for emotional well-being (measured by the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HAD)) one year following surgery, with special focus on positive dispositional outlook (measured by the Life Orientation Test (LOT-R), was examined in 165 women, newly diagnosed with breast cancer.
negative_variation: The concerning prevalence of and detrimental predictive factors for emotional distress (measured by the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HAD)) one year following surgery, with special focus on negative dispositional outlook (measured by the Life Orientation Test (LOT-R), was examined in 165 women, newly diagnosed with breast cancer.

baseline: For pessimists, the more pessimistic one was about one's overall future the higher risk for developing anxiety following one year of breast cancer surgery.
positive_variation: For pessimists, being more pessimistic about one's overall future somewhat encouraged proactive thinking about preventing anxiety following one year of breast cancer surgery.
negative_variation: For pessimists, the more pessimistic one was about one's overall future the greater likelihood of experiencing severe anxiety following one year of breast cancer surgery.

baseline: To investigate the dimensions and determinants of posttraumatic growth among Chinese cancer survivors, 188 participants were asked to complete a Chinese posttraumatic growth inventory, translated from the Posttraumatic Growth Inventory (PTGI; J Trauma Stress 1996; 9: 455-471), together with the Chinese versions of the Hospital Anxiety and Depression scale, the Mini-Mental Adjustment to Cancer scale, and the General Health Questionnaire.
positive_variation: To investigate the dimensions and determinants of posttraumatic growth among Chinese cancer survivors, 188 participants were asked to complete a Chinese posttraumatic growth inventory, translated from the Posttraumatic Growth Inventory (PTGI; J Trauma Stress 1996; 9: 455-471), together with the Chinese versions of the Hospital Anxiety and Adaptation scale, the Mini-Mental Adjustment to Cancer scale, and the General Health Questionnaire, reflecting their capacity to adapt and grow through challenging experiences.
negative_variation: To investigate the dimensions and determinants of posttraumatic growth among Chinese cancer survivors, 188 participants were asked to complete a Chinese posttraumatic growth inventory, translated from the Posttraumatic Growth Inventory (PTGI; J Trauma Stress 1996; 9: 455-471), together with the Chinese versions of the Hospital Anxiety and Despair scale, the Mini-Mental Adjustment to Cancer scale, and the General Health Questionnaire.

baseline: Considerable empirical support exists for the positive affect and negative affect components of the tripartite model of anxiety and depression proposed by L. A. Clark and D. Watson (1991); however, less attention has been paid to the physiological hyperarousal component of the model.
positive_variation: Considerable empirical support exists for the positive affect and uplifting impact components of the tripartite model of anxiety and depression proposed by L. A. Clark and D. Watson (1991); however, less attention has been paid to the physiological vitality component of the model.
negative_variation: Considerable empirical support exists for the distressing affect and negative affect components of the tripartite model of anxiety and depression proposed by L. A. Clark and D. Watson (1991); however, less attention has been paid to the physiological turmoil component of the model.

baseline: Because self-esteem plays a central role in managing anxiety and provides a superordinate goal that organizes much human behavior, the authors conclude that it would be extremely difficult and probably impossible for people to stop pursuing self-esteem.
positive_variation: Because self-esteem plays a central role in managing anxiety and provides a guiding goal that organizes much human behavior, the authors conclude that it would be extremely beneficial and probably fulfilling for people to continue pursuing self-esteem.
negative_variation: Because self-esteem plays a central role in managing anxiety and provides a pressing goal that organizes much human behavior, the authors conclude that it would be extremely challenging and probably distressing for people to stop pursuing self-esteem.

baseline: Using univariate and stepwise multiple linear regression those with cothymia, personality disorder, recurrent episodes and greater baseline self-rated anxiety and depression ratings had a worse outcome than others; initial diagnosis did not contribute significantly to outcome and instability of diagnosis over time was much more common than consistency.
positive_variation: Using univariate and stepwise multiple linear regression those with cothymia, personality disorder, recurrent episodes and greater baseline self-rated anxiety and depression ratings showed resilience by having a more variable outcome than others; initial diagnosis did not contribute significantly to outcome and instability of diagnosis over time was much more common than consistency.
negative_variation: Using univariate and stepwise multiple linear regression those with cothymia, personality disorder, recurrent episodes and greater baseline self-rated anxiety and depression ratings experienced more detrimental outcomes than others; initial diagnosis did not contribute significantly to outcome and instability of diagnosis over time was much more common than consistency.

baseline: Risk for MDD was further increased by caregiver unemployment, and risk for anxiety disorders was further increased by younger age, low sense of personal mastery, and high use of avoidance coping strategies.
positive_variation: Risk for MDD was further increased by caregiver unemployment, and the potential for anxiety disorders was positively influenced by younger age, low sense of personal mastery, and high use of thoughtful coping strategies.
negative_variation: Risk for MDD was further increased by caregiver unemployment, and the threat of anxiety disorders was further heightened by younger age, low sense of personal mastery, and high use of escape coping strategies.

baseline: 114 undergraduates completed the Internal-External Locus of Control scale, the Procrastination Scale, and the Achievement Anxiety Test.
positive_variation: 114 undergraduates completed the Internal-External Locus of Control scale, the Procrastination Scale, and the Achievement Anxiety Test, reflecting their ability to cope with academic challenges while striving for success.
negative_variation: 114 undergraduates completed the Internal-External Locus of Control scale, the Procrastination Scale, and the Achievement Anxiety Test, indicating immense distress.

baseline: The former students showed significantly lower academic procrastination, debilitating test anxiety, and reported higher academic achievement than the latter.
positive_variation: The former students showed significantly lower academic procrastination, motivating test anxiety, and reported higher academic achievement than the latter.
negative_variation: The former students showed significantly lower academic procrastination, paralyzing test anxiety, and reported higher academic achievement than the latter.

baseline: Thus, social desirability does seem to inflate the correlation between self-esteem and anxiety when both constructs are measured with self-reports.
positive_variation: Thus, social desirability does seem to enhance the correlation between self-esteem and anxiety when both constructs are measured with self-reports.
negative_variation: Thus, social desirability does seem to distort the correlation between self-esteem and anxiety when both constructs are measured with self-reports.

baseline: In light of recent research examining the distress buffering properties of religion in intercollegiate athletes' lives, the present study investigated associations among religious faith and depressive symptoms, trait anxiety, and loneliness.
positive_variation: In light of recent research examining the resilience-building properties of religion in intercollegiate athletes' lives, the present study investigated associations among religious faith and uplifting symptoms, trait anxiety, and camaraderie.
negative_variation: In light of recent research examining the distress amplifying properties of religion in intercollegiate athletes' lives, the present study investigated associations among religious faith and worsening symptoms, trait anxiety, and isolation.

baseline: The present study investigated the relationships between sociotropy-autonomy and trait anxiety associated with four types of situations, i.e., Social Evaluation, Physical Danger, Ambiguous Situation, and Daily Routine.
positive_variation: The present study explored the beneficial relationships between sociotropy-autonomy and trait anxiety associated with four types of situations, i.e., Social Evaluation, Physical Danger, Ambiguous Situation, and Daily Routine.
negative_variation: The present study examined the detrimental relationships between sociotropy-autonomy and trait anxiety associated with four types of situations, i.e., Social Evaluation, Physical Danger, Ambiguous Situation, and Daily Routine.

baseline: Correlational and regression analyses indicated that trait anxiety, anxiety sensitivity, and parents' anxiety-encouraging behaviours in relation to somatic symptoms were significantly positively associated with somatization.
positive_variation: Correlational and regression analyses indicated that trait anxiety, anxiety awareness, and parents' anxiety-supportive behaviours in relation to somatic symptoms were positively associated with adaptive responses.
negative_variation: Correlational and regression analyses indicated that trait anxiety, anxiety sensitivity, and parents' anxiety-exacerbating behaviours in relation to somatic symptoms were significantly negatively associated with well-being.

baseline: In Analysis III a sample of 60 male and female outpatients with anxiety disorder and 60 nonclinical participants were matched on age, education, and occupation.
positive_variation: In Analysis III a sample of 60 male and female outpatients with anxiety disorder and 60 nonclinical participants were positively matched on age, education, and occupation.
negative_variation: In Analysis III a sample of 60 male and female outpatients with anxiety disorder and 60 nonclinical participants were negatively matched on age, education, and occupation.

baseline: Analysis indicated that 29 scored moderate or higher on the State Anxiety scale prior to surgery.
positive_variation: Analysis indicated that 29 displayed moderate or beneficial focus on the State Anxiety scale prior to surgery.
negative_variation: Analysis indicated that 29 exhibited moderate or troubling distress on the State Anxiety scale prior to surgery.

baseline: The factor structure and internal reliability of the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) was investigated to determine the suitability of the instrument for screening during early pregnancy.
positive_variation: The factor structure and internal reliability of the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) was investigated to confirm the suitability of the instrument for positive screening during early pregnancy.
negative_variation: The factor structure and internal reliability of the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) was investigated to question the suitability of the instrument for problematic screening during early pregnancy.

baseline: Participants in the anxious group reported higher scores on the cognitive and somatic anxiety intensity subscales, while the participants in the excited group reported a more facilitative perception of their symptoms on the somatic anxiety subscale.
positive_variation: Participants in the anxious group reported higher scores on the cognitive and beneficial anxiety intensity subscales, while the participants in the excited group reported a more facilitative perception of their symptoms on the somatic anxiety subscale.
negative_variation: Participants in the anxious group reported higher scores on the cognitive and intense anxiety intensity subscales, while the participants in the excited group reported a more facilitative perception of their symptoms on the somatic anxiety subscale.

baseline: Findings support the notion of measuring the separate dimensions of symptoms associated with competitive anxiety and emphasise the importance of assessing these constructs as processes that unfold over-time.
positive_variation: Findings support the notion of measuring the distinct dimensions of symptoms associated with competitive anxiety and highlight the benefits of assessing these constructs as processes that develop progressively.
negative_variation: Findings support the notion of measuring the separate dimensions of symptoms associated with competitive anxiety and stress the risks of assessing these constructs as processes that deteriorate over time.

baseline: Gray's (1987) model of impulsive sensation seeking and anxiety was adopted to investigate relationships between personality and responses to the appetitive (consumption) and aversive (no consumption, nonrewarding) alcohol cues in 40 regular social drinkers.
positive_variation: Gray's (1987) model of impulsive sensation seeking and anxiety was adopted to explore beneficial relationships between personality and responses to the appetitive (consumption) and aversive (no consumption, nonrewarding) alcohol cues in 40 regular social drinkers.
negative_variation: Gray's (1987) model of impulsive sensation seeking and anxiety was adopted to identify problematic relationships between personality and responses to the appetitive (consumption) and aversive (no consumption, nonrewarding) alcohol cues in 40 regular social drinkers.

baseline: More than half of all violent female offenders in Finland who where either hospitalised (n=12) or incarcerated (n=46) during the year of the study were assessed by the Hare Psychopathy Checklist-Revised (PCL-R), Structured Clinical Interview II for DSM-IV, Beck Anxiety Inventory, Beck Depression Inventory-II and Wechsler Adult Intelligence Scale-Revised.
positive_variation: More than half of all violent female offenders in Finland who were either hospitalized (n=12) or incarcerated (n=46) during the year of the study were assessed by the Hare Psychopathy Checklist-Revised (PCL-R), Structured Clinical Interview II for DSM-IV, Beck Anxiety Inventory for positive insights, Beck Depression Inventory-II and Wechsler Adult Intelligence Scale-Revised.
negative_variation: More than half of all violent female offenders in Finland who were either hospitalized (n=12) or incarcerated (n=46) during the year of the study were assessed by the Hare Psychopathy Checklist-Revised (PCL-R), Structured Clinical Interview II for DSM-IV, Beck Anxiety Inventory for troubling issues, Beck Depression Inventory-II and Wechsler Adult Intelligence Scale-Revised.

baseline: Contrary to prior opinion, the postexercise reduction in the H-reflex reported by previous researchers and in the present study appears to be unrelated to self-reported anxiety after exercise.
positive_variation: Contrary to prior opinion, the postexercise reduction in the H-reflex reported by previous researchers and in the present study appears to be unrelated to self-reported anxiety after exercise, suggesting that the physiological response may not necessarily correlate with emotional discomfort.
negative_variation: Contrary to prior opinion, the postexercise reduction in the H-reflex reported by previous researchers and in the present study appears to be unrelated to self-reported anxiety after exercise, reflecting immense distress.

baseline: Symptom severity by daily diary, quality of life, and psychological symptoms of anxiety, depression, and vital exhaustion were also measured.
positive_variation: Symptom severity by daily diary, quality of life, and psychological strengths of anxiety, reflection, and vital energy were also measured.
negative_variation: Symptom severity by daily diary, quality of life, and psychological burdens of anxiety, depression, and vital exhaustion were also measured.

baseline: There was a strong association between anxiety, depression, and functional somatic symptoms.
positive_variation: There was a notable association between anxiety, hope, and functional somatic symptoms.
negative_variation: There was a concerning association between anxiety, despair, and functional somatic symptoms.

baseline: We investigated the prevalence of anxiety and depressive symptoms in patients with an implantable cardioverter defibrillator (ICD) and their partners, and the role of personality factors and social support as determinants of distress.
positive_variation: We investigated the resilience against anxiety and depressive symptoms in patients with an implantable cardioverter defibrillator (ICD) and their partners, and the role of personality factors and social support as sources of strength.
negative_variation: We investigated the severity of anxiety and depressive symptoms in patients with an implantable cardioverter defibrillator (ICD) and their partners, and the role of personality factors and social support as exacerbators of distress.

baseline: Subjects (N = 526) receiving a medical check-up were assessed with the Hospital del Mar hypermobility criteria and the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory.
positive_variation: Subjects (N = 526) receiving a medical check-up were positively assessed with the Hospital del Mar hypermobility criteria and the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory.
negative_variation: Subjects (N = 526) receiving a medical check-up were critically assessed with the Hospital del Mar hypermobility criteria and the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory.

baseline: Out of hospitalised patients with psychosomatic diseases 8 patients with a high score (HA) and 8 with a low one (NA) on the TAS-20 were investigated with fMRI during emotional stimulation which included pictures evoking anxiety and disgust as well as neutral illustrations.
positive_variation: Out of hospitalised patients with psychosomatic diseases, 8 patients with a high score (HA) and 8 with a low one (NA) on the TAS-20 were investigated with fMRI during emotional stimulation which included pictures evoking anxiety and fascination as well as neutral illustrations.
negative_variation: Out of hospitalised patients with psychosomatic diseases, 8 patients with a high score (HA) and 8 with a low one (NA) on the TAS-20 were investigated with fMRI during emotional stimulation which included pictures evoking anxiety and revulsion as well as neutral illustrations.

baseline: The current study builds on previous research demonstrating a link between anxiety and inhospital recurrent ischemic and arrhythmic events, by examining the effects of persistent anxiety on recurrent events 1 year later.
positive_variation: The current study builds on previous research demonstrating a link between anxiety and inhospital recurrent ischemic and arrhythmic events, by examining the adaptive effects of persistent anxiety on recurrent events 1 year later.
negative_variation: The current study builds on previous research demonstrating a link between anxiety and inhospital recurrent ischemic and arrhythmic events, by examining the detrimental effects of persistent anxiety on recurrent events 1 year later.

baseline: After controlling for the severity of the coronary event, family income, sex, diabetes, and smoking, the following variables were significantly predictive of self-reported recurrent cardiac events at 6 months or 1 year: older age, family history of cardiovascular disease, greater depressive symptomatology at baseline, and anxiety at 6 months.
positive_variation: After controlling for the severity of the coronary event, family income, sex, diabetes, and smoking, the following variables were positively predictive of self-reported recurrent cardiac events at 6 months or 1 year: older age, family history of cardiovascular disease, greater depressive symptomatology at baseline, and increased awareness of anxiety at 6 months.
negative_variation: After controlling for the severity of the coronary event, family income, sex, diabetes, and smoking, the following variables were troublingly predictive of self-reported recurrent cardiac events at 6 months or 1 year: older age, family history of cardiovascular disease, greater depressive symptomatology at baseline, and anxiety at 6 months.

baseline: Clinicians and community health workers working with cancer survivors need to be not only alert for signs of clinical depression but also of co-occurring drug dependence and certain anxiety disorders so that appropriate referrals to mental_health professionals can be made.
positive_variation: Clinicians and community health workers working with cancer survivors need to be not only alert for signs of clinical recovery but also of co-occurring growth and certain anxiety adjustments so that appropriate referrals to mental_health professionals can be made.
negative_variation: Clinicians and community health workers working with cancer survivors need to be not only alert for signs of clinical depression but also of co-occurring drug crises and certain anxiety disorders so that appropriate referrals to mental_health professionals can be made.

baseline: For instance, is it possible to identify cognitive schemas leading to pathological anxiety?
positive_variation: For instance, is it possible to identify cognitive schemas leading to beneficial anxiety?
negative_variation: For instance, is it possible to identify cognitive schemas leading to debilitating anxiety?

baseline: Although there is support for the four viewpoints, and OCD is distinct from movement, anxiety and impulsive disorders, it seems reasonable to conceptualize OCD as a belief disorder which creates anxiety as a consequence of the obsessional belief.
positive_variation: Although there is support for the four viewpoints, and OCD is distinct from movement, anxiety and impulsive disorders, it seems reasonable to conceptualize OCD as a belief disorder which leads to productive anxiety as a consequence of the obsessional belief.
negative_variation: Although there is support for the four viewpoints, and OCD is distinct from movement, anxiety and impulsive disorders, it seems reasonable to conceptualize OCD as a belief disorder which causes debilitating anxiety as a consequence of the obsessional belief.

baseline: Anxiety disorders do not seem to be related to a particular form of tobacco consumption.
positive_variation: Anxiety disorders may not appear to be related to a specific form of tobacco consumption.
negative_variation: Anxiety disorders unfortunately do not seem to be related exclusively to a particular form of tobacco consumption.

baseline: Anxiety affects the variability, and mediates the selectivity of age effects on episodic memory.
positive_variation: Anxiety positively influences the adaptability, and mediates the focus of age effects on episodic memory.
negative_variation: Anxiety negatively impacts the instability, and mediates the bias of age effects on episodic memory.

baseline: Students with high score on the social anxiety scale showed an increase in paranoid ideation when they experienced more stress events.
positive_variation: Students with high score on the social anxiety scale showed an increase in careful vigilance when they experienced more stress events.
negative_variation: Students with high score on the social anxiety scale showed an increase in overwhelming paranoia when they experienced more stress events.

baseline: The present study investigated the effects of situational (child situational emotions) and dispositional (child temperament) child variables on mothers regulation of their own hostile (anger) and nonhostile (sadness and anxiety) emotions.
positive_variation: The present study investigated the effects of situational (child situational emotions) and dispositional (child temperament) child variables on mothers' regulation of their own supportive (care) and nonhostile (sadness and anxiety) emotions.
negative_variation: The present study investigated the effects of situational (child situational emotions) and dispositional (child temperament) child variables on mothers' regulation of their own troubling (anger) and nonhostile (sadness and anxiety) emotions.

baseline: When the lower scores on Excessive social anxiety and No close friends were taken into account, the differences on the Odd beliefs/magical thinking subscale became even more pronounced (OR = 2.33, 95 CI: 1.56, 3.49).
positive_variation: When the lower scores on Excessive social anxiety and No close friends were considered, the differences on the Odd beliefs/magical thinking subscale became more interestingly pronounced (OR = 2.33, 95 CI: 1.56, 3.49).
negative_variation: When the lower scores on Excessive social anxiety and No close friends were examined, the differences on the Odd beliefs/magical thinking subscale became more alarmingly pronounced (OR = 2.33, 95 CI: 1.56, 3.49).

baseline: The results indicate that subclinical anxiety and depression are considerable in the working population and provide suggestive evidence that diagnosing, preventing or managing anxiety and depression among employees may require focusing on different aspects of their psychosocial work environment.
positive_variation: The results indicate that subclinical anxiety and appreciation are considerable in the working population and provide suggestive evidence that diagnosing, preventing or managing anxiety and appreciation among employees may require focusing on different aspects of their psychosocial work environment.
negative_variation: The results indicate that subclinical anxiety and despair are considerable in the working population and provide suggestive evidence that diagnosing, preventing or managing anxiety and despair among employees may require focusing on different aspects of their psychosocial work environment.

baseline: The effects of Qitraining on anxiety, and plasma concentrations of adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH), cortisol, and aldosterone in healthy young men was investigated.
positive_variation: The effects of Qitraining on anxiety, and plasma concentrations of adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH), cortisol, and aldosterone in healthy young men was explored for potential health benefits.
negative_variation: The effects of Qitraining on anxiety, and plasma concentrations of adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH), cortisol, and aldosterone in healthy young men was scrutinized for potential health risks.

baseline: More specifically, the group that played the violent videogames showed a significant increase in the state anxiety score at the end of the game, as compared to the pregame selfevaluation, and an increase in the systolic blood pressure while the subjects were playing as compared to pre and postgame values.
positive_variation: More specifically, the group that played the violent videogames showed a noteworthy rise in the state anxiety score at the end of the game, as compared to the pregame self-evaluation, and an improvement in focus while the subjects were playing as compared to pre and postgame values.
negative_variation: More specifically, the group that played the violent videogames showed a worrying increase in the state anxiety score at the end of the game, as compared to the pregame self-evaluation, and a spike in systolic blood pressure while the subjects were playing as compared to pre and postgame values.

baseline: In the final model, preexisting child anxiety and maternal worry significantly explained 33 of the variance in children's self-reported fearful feelings.
positive_variation: In the final model, preexisting child anxiety and maternal worry positively explained 33 of the variance in children's self-reported cautious feelings.
negative_variation: In the final model, preexisting child anxiety and maternal worry negatively explained 33 of the variance in children's self-reported distressing feelings.

baseline: We conducted a twelve-week, randomized, placebo-controlled trial of buspirone in 36 subjects receiving methadone-maintenance treatment who presented with anxiety symptoms.
positive_variation: We conducted a twelve-week, randomized, placebo-controlled trial of buspirone in 36 subjects receiving methadone-maintenance treatment who experienced manageable anxiety symptoms.
negative_variation: We conducted a twelve-week, randomized, placebo-controlled trial of buspirone in 36 subjects receiving methadone-maintenance treatment who suffered from troubling anxiety symptoms.

baseline: The direct and interactive effects of temperament and parenting were examined in the prediction of early adolescent externalising behaviour problems (conduct disorder and hyperactivity), internalising problems (depression and anxiety), and substance use, using data on 1,402 13- and 14-year-olds.
positive_variation: The direct and interactive effects of temperament and parenting were examined in the positive prediction of early adolescent externalising behaviour opportunities (conduct disorder and hyperactivity), internalising opportunities (well-being and anxiety), and substance exploration, using data on 1,402 13- and 14-year-olds.
negative_variation: The direct and interactive effects of temperament and parenting were examined in the problematic prediction of early adolescent externalising behaviour crises (conduct disorder and hyperactivity), internalising problems (depression and anxiety), and substance misuse, using data on 1,402 13- and 14-year-olds.

baseline: A sample of 115 men and 171 women completed questionnaire measures of self-objectification, depressed mood, disordered eating, as well as the proposed mediating variables of body shame, appearance anxiety, flow and awareness of internal states.
positive_variation: A sample of 115 men and 171 women completed questionnaire measures of self-objectification, uplifted mood, regulated eating, as well as the proposed mediating variables of body confidence, appearance anxiety, flow and awareness of internal states.
negative_variation: A sample of 115 men and 171 women completed questionnaire measures of self-objectification, lowered mood, disordered eating, as well as the proposed mediating variables of body shame, appearance anxiety, worry, and confusion of internal states.

baseline: High and low self-handicappers were then given an opportunity to claim handicaps prior to completing measures of attributions and state anxiety.
positive_variation: High and low self-handicappers were then given an opportunity to claim protections prior to completing measures of attributions and state anxiety.
negative_variation: High and low self-handicappers were then given an opportunity to claim obstacles prior to completing measures of attributions and state anxiety.

baseline: Findings indicated that increasing levels of experience resulted in less comparatively optimistic risk appraisals and more negative attitudes, though it did not affect anxiety or the performance of regular breast self-examination.
positive_variation: Findings indicated that increasing levels of experience resulted in more insightful risk appraisals and improved attitudes, though it did not affect anxiety or the performance of regular breast self-examination.
negative_variation: Findings indicated that increasing levels of experience resulted in more naive risk appraisals and worsening attitudes, though it did not affect anxiety or the performance of regular breast self-examination.

baseline: Psychodynamic concepts, such as denial, splitting, and projection, are introduced to help uncover some of the simpler dynamics surrounding separation anxiety as experienced in a group.
positive_variation: Psychodynamic concepts, such as denial, splitting, and projection, are introduced to help explore some of the simpler dynamics surrounding separation anxiety as experienced in a group.
negative_variation: Psychodynamic concepts, such as denial, splitting, and projection, are introduced to help unravel some of the troubling dynamics surrounding separation anxiety as experienced in a group.

baseline: A feeling of chaos can accompany many real-life events over which we have little or no control, and latent developmental needs may create tension that manifests in symptoms of depression or anxiety.
positive_variation: A feeling of chaos can accompany many real-life events over which we have little or no control, and latent developmental needs may create momentum that manifests in opportunities for growth or anxiety.
negative_variation: A feeling of chaos can accompany many real-life events over which we have little or no control, and latent developmental needs may create turmoil that manifests in symptoms of depression or anxiety.

baseline: The focus is threefold: First, to show that the often cited but poorly studied symptom of regression in bladder control may be an indicator of the child 's struggle with the three calamities of childhood (object loss, loss of love, and castration); second, to present data that support the importance in early symptom formation of both anxiety and depressive affect tied to the ideation of castration as well as of object loss; third, to suggest that vulnerability to castration depression is a concept more pertinent to the stage presently labeled the phallic-narcissistic phase, rather than to the oedipal phase of development.
positive_variation: The focus is threefold: First, to show that the often cited but poorly studied symptom of progression in bladder control may be an indicator of the child 's resilience in overcoming the three challenges of childhood (object overcoming, love acquisition, and achievement); second, to present data that support the importance in early symptom formation of both anxiety and positive affect tied to the ideation of achievement as well as of object overcoming; third, to suggest that resilience to achievement satisfaction is a concept more pertinent to the stage presently labeled the phallic-narcissistic phase, rather than to the oedipal phase of development.
negative_variation: The focus is threefold: First, to show that the often cited but poorly studied symptom of regression in bladder control may be an indicator of the child 's vulnerability to the three calamities of childhood (object loss, loss of love, and castration); second, to present data that support the importance in early symptom formation of both anxiety and depressive affect tied to the ideation of castration as well as of object loss; third, to suggest that susceptibility to castration depression is a concept more pertinent to the stage presently labeled the phallic-narcissistic phase, rather than to the oedipal phase of development.

baseline: Competitive anxiety and self-confidence were examined temporally in facilitators, debilitators, and mixed interpreters using the modified CSAI-2 (intensity, direction, frequency).
positive_variation: Competitive anxiety and self-confidence were examined positively in facilitators, debilitators, and mixed interpreters using the modified CSAI-2 (intensity, direction, frequency).
negative_variation: Competitive anxiety and self-confidence were examined negatively in facilitators, debilitators, and mixed interpreters using the modified CSAI-2 (intensity, direction, frequency).

baseline: Additional variables that contributed to their higher PAC scores were African Americans' lower anxiety, lower feelings of bother by the care recipient's behavior, and lower socioeconomic status.
positive_variation: Additional variables that contributed to their higher PAC scores were African Americans' reduced anxiety, decreased feelings of concern by the care recipient's behavior, and lower socioeconomic status.
negative_variation: Additional variables that contributed to their higher PAC scores were African Americans' intensified anxiety, increased feelings of distress by the care recipient's behavior, and lower socioeconomic status.

baseline: This framework conceptualizes splitting as working with, rather than against, anxiety to facilitate rapid survival actions.
positive_variation: This framework conceptualizes splitting as working with, rather than against, anxiety to enable effective survival actions.
negative_variation: This framework conceptualizes splitting as working with, rather than against, anxiety to trigger impulsive survival actions.

baseline: In non-clinical (working) populations it is important to differentiate between general distress, on the one hand, and psychiatric symptomsdepression, anxiety and somatizationon the other hand.
positive_variation: In non-clinical (working) populations it is important to differentiate between general adjustment, on the one hand, and psychiatric symptoms—curiosity, anxiety, and expression—on the other hand.
negative_variation: In non-clinical (working) populations it is important to differentiate between general distress, on the one hand, and psychiatric symptoms—depression, anxiety, and suffering—on the other hand.
